required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cross-sectional Survey on Patients With Urinary Tract Infections in Puy-de-Dôme : Epidemiology of Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections and Risk Factors
clinical_study.official_title: Cross-sectional Survey on Patients With Urinary Tract Infections in Puy-de-Dôme : Epidemiology of Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections and Risk Factors

collaborator.agency: Caisse Primaire d'Assurance Maladie du Puy-de-Dôme

brief_summary.textblock: Urinary tract infections (UTI) are an important part of infectious diseases. For some patients, those infections are recurrent and have many consequences such as altered quality of life, recurrent symptoms, antibiotics overuse… The primary purpose of this study is to estimate the proportion of patients in Puy-de-Dôme with recurrent urinary tract infections among patients with at least one UTI during 2019. The secondary purposes are : characteristics of patients with recurrent UTI, by sex ; determine predictive factors of recurrent UTI, by sex ; describe bacterial ecology of recurrent UTI and the proportion of multi-resistant bacteria.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of recurrent urinary tract infections
primary_outcome.description: Proportion, with its 95% confidence interval, of recurrent urinary tract infections, by sex, in the population of Puy-de-Dôme who reported having had at least one urinary tract infection in the year 2019. The diagnosis of recurrent urinary tract infection will be at least 3 urinary tract infections in one year

secondary_outcome.description: Risk factors of recurrent urinary tract infections
Risk factors of recurrent urinary tract infections
Risk factors of recurrent urinary tract infections
Risk factors of recurrent urinary tract infections

secondary_outcome.measure: number of visits at the general practitioner
secondary_outcome.description: measure of healthcare consumption with the number of visits at the general practitioner performed
measure of healthcare consumption with the number of urinalysis performed
measure of healthcare consumption with the number of antibiotic therapies performed
quality of life evaluated with a self-reported questionnaire inspired by the Leicester Impact Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: bacteriological characteristics of recurrent urinary tract infections
secondary_outcome.description: evaluated with results of urinalysis, bacterial identification and antimicrobial susceptibility

arm_group.description: patients with at least 3 episodes of UTI during 2019
patients with one or two episodes of UTI during 2019

study_pop.textblock: Adults with at least one urinary tract infection during year 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient from 18 years old
- affiliated to the french healthcare system
- with at least one urinary tract infection during year 2019
- has accepted email contact with CPAM 63 (Caisse Primaire d'Assurance Maladie du Puy-de-Dôme)
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy during year 2019
- none urinary tract infection reported in 2019
